member.name: T:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.GSVOPTS
member.summary:
Constants for mananging wait times and subscription timeouts used with getServerValues methods.
Since: XHQ 4.0

member.name: F:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.GSVOPTS.__Fields.WAIT_NOWAIT
member.summary: Server Get Values option: do not wait, return value immediately.

member.name: F:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.GSVOPTS.__Fields.WAIT_INFINITE
member.summary: Server Get Values option: wait for all values requested to be of quality other than "Bad, Not Initialized" before returning.

member.name: F:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.GSVOPTS.__Fields.SUBSCRIPTION_CANCEL
member.summary: Server Get Values option: cancel any outstanding subscription for the items on behalf of this connection using the get values mechanism.

member.name: F:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.GSVOPTS.__Fields.SUBSCRIPTION_INFINITE
member.summary: Server Get Values option: make a permanent server-side subscription to all items requested on behalf of this connection using the get values mechanism.

member.name: F:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.GSVOPTS.__Fields.SUBSCRIPTION_NOCHANGE
member.summary: Server Get Values option: make no changes to a any server-side subscription made previously using the get values mechanism for the items requested

member.name: T:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.ICollectionUpdate
member.summary: This interface is used to deliver collection updates to a subscriber.

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.ICollectionUpdate.onUpdate(com.indx.xhq.util.VTQ,com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolItem)
member.summary: Called when a subscribed global collection is updated with new data. The VTQ instance passed as an argument represents the collection data as a whole. The timestamp, expiration and quality represent the data update time, when the data will expire and the overall quality of the data respectively. The actual value is meaningless and is always an integer equal to Integer.MAX_VALUE. The item represents the object for which the notifyOnUpdate method was originally called.
member.param: represents the timestamp, expiration and quality of the collection data as a whole
the global collection, member collection or nested collection that generated the update

member.name: T:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT
member.summary: The RESULT interface defines the list of result codes that can come from the XHQ Solution Server.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT.ERROR_NONE
member.summary: There was no error; the request was completed successfully.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT.ERROR_BAD_REQUEST
member.summary: The request was malformed or inappropriate in some way.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT.ERROR_ITEM_NOT_FOUND
member.summary: The requested item (object, class) was not found.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT.ERROR_NETWORK_FAILURE
member.summary: There was a problem communicating the request to the server.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT.ERROR_INVALID_REFERENCE_ID
member.summary: The referenced ID was not valid.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT.ERROR_OVERLOAD
member.summary: The server is overloaded.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT.ERROR_ACCESS_DENIED
member.summary: The request was denied due to lack of proper priveleges.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT.ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED
member.summary: The request is not supported by the server.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT.ERROR_NOT_LICENSED
member.summary: The operation is not allow due to license restrictions.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT.ERROR_INVALID_NAME
member.summary: The operation is not allow due to license restrictions.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT.ERROR_BUSY_TRY_AGAIN
member.summary: The server is not able to complete request - try again later.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT.ERROR_DELAYED
member.summary: The server has delayed processing of the request.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT.ERROR_VERSION_NOT_SUPPORTED
member.summary: The server refused the request due to version compatibility restrictions.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT.ERROR_CLASS_MEMBER_OUT_OF_BOUNDS
member.summary: The server refused to save the component due to the number of members exceeding the limit.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT.ERROR_CLASS_INHERITANCE_OVERFLOW
member.summary: The server refused to save the component due to its inheritance level exceeding the limit.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.RESULT.ERROR_OPERATION_IN_PROGRESS
member.summary: The requested operation is already in progress.

member.name: T:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolCollectionSet
member.summary:
The SolCollectionSet class represents the data returned from a collection query. A collection set operates in a manner similar to java.sql.RowSet interface. After the set is created by a query call (to a SolCollection instance or similar), call the next() method to move to the next row of data. Please be aware that when the local cache of rows is exhausted, the next() call may trigger a communication with the XHQ Solution Server to fetch more rows. The maximum number of rows fetched during one of these communications can be controlled by using the setMaxFetchRows.
A collection set only allows forward retrieval of rows. You may restart from the beginning using the requery() method.
If the query includes nested collections, a nested collection query may be performed any time after next() is invoked. The resulting collection set is a query of the nested collection in the context of the current row in the original set.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolCollectionSet.MINROWS
member.summary: The minimum number allowable when specifying how many rows to fetch from the XHQ Solution Server when the local cache of rows is exhausted.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolCollectionSet.DEFAULTROWS
member.summary: The default number of rows to fetch from the XHQ Solution Server when the local cache of rows is exhausted.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolCollectionSet.MAXROWS
member.summary: The maximum number allowable when specifying how many rows to fetch from the XHQ Solution Server when the local cache of rows is exhausted.

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolCollectionSet.setMaxFetchRows(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the maximum number of rows that can be received from the XHQ Solution Server whenever more rows are fetched. This method can be called whenenver is convenient but will only take effect the next time rows are fetched from the server. The default value is defined by DEFAULTROWS. The minimum allowable value is defined by MINROWS. The maximum is defined by MAXROWS.
member.param: maximum number of rows to fetch from solution server

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolCollectionSet.getMaxFetchRows
member.summary:
Returns the maximum number of rows that may be returned at each retrieval from the Solution Server.
Since: XHQ 3.7 SP2 b123

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolCollectionSet.getBooleanValue(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Return the boolean value corresponding to the indicated column number. The following conversion rules are used with the various data types:
invalid or NULL is converted to false
an integer value of 0 is converted to false and any other number is converted to true
a floating point value of 0.0 is converted to false and any other number is converted to true
a string value of "true" is converted to true and any other string is converted to false
member.param: one-based column number
member.returns: the boolean value of the column
member.exception: if the set is in an invalid state such as when there was an error in the original query.
if the column number supplied is less than 1 or greater than the total number of columns in the data set

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolCollectionSet.getIntValue(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Return a value of the target type: int
This value will be based on the value in the indicated column number.
The following conversion rules are used with the various data types:
invalid or null column values are converted to zero
column values of boolean type are converted to zero if false and one if true
column values of any numeric types are constrained to the range allowed by the target type
column values of any floating-point type are truncated
column values of any character string type are parsed to the target type, or converted to zero, if parsing fails
column values of any time type are treated as zero
member.param: one-based column number
member.returns: the value of the column converted to the target type
member.exception: if the set is in an invalid state such as when there was an error in the original query.
if the column number supplied is less than 1 or greater than the total number of columns in the data set

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolCollectionSet.queryMemberRollups(com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolMemberNestedCollection,com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolRollupRequest[],com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolQueryCriteria)
member.summary:
Query a nested collection member for roll-up values with the given query criteria in the context of the current row. Returns set of roll-up values (a single row of columns).
Performance note regarding requests and criteria parameters: Using member names instead of member IDs may severely impact performance since the names must be resolved with the XHQ Solution Server for EACH ROW of the parent collection queried. Please resolve these names and use the member IDs to build the rollup requests and/or criteria (using SolCollectionCriterion).

member.name: T:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolCollectionUpdateSet
member.summary:
The SolCollectionUpdateSet class instances allow modification of data in a global collection set by update of existing data or insertion of new data.
Only global collections that have been configured properly can be updated using this class. The global collctoin must use the XHQ Cache Group and configured to not update via query. Also, the collection's access settings must have write permssion enabled for the user associated with the client connection.
Collection data sets are populated in two different styles. The primary style that is most familiar to the XHQ application developer is the polled style. In this style, an update set is initialized with the update flag set to false. The set is populated row by row using a series of ROWOP.INSERT operations. When finished the new set of data is published and all clients are notified.
The second style is an update style method. This style performs operations on the existing data set for the collection in the cache. Operations can include the insertion of rows into the cache, the deletion of rows from the cache and the update of existing rows in the cache. Updates require two row operations to perform a single update. You must first identify the existing row fully in the cache by specifying a row with ROWOP.UPDATE_KEY and all the columns with the previous data. The following row specifies the change to the row and the operation must be ROWOP.UPDATE. Specifying unpaired update operations is not valid and may lead to unpredictable results. An update operation has different behavior from a SQL UPDATE statment. When updating a row, the key column(s) may not be changed with the setValue(). All other columns will have the update values specified with setValue() or NULL if no setValue() is used for the column.
Also note that ROWOP.DELETE requires the deleted row to be fully identified.
The proper style for using this interface is to use the following pattern:
call initializeUpdate() to initialize the update set
call isInitAllowed() to determine if the collection can be updated
call setRowOperation() and setValue() for the current row
call next() to commit current operation row
repeat the last two steps for each operation row that is needed
call finishUpdate() to complete all updates
You can repeat this overall pattern again and again for various updates to the collection.

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolCollectionUpdateSet.setValue(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Set the value corresponding to the indicated column number. Column numbers are one-based. The following conversion rules are used with the various data types:
for columns of boolean type, no conversion is performed
for columns of integer type, true is converted to 1 and false is converted to 0
for columns of long type, true is converted to 1L and false is converted to 0L
for columns of float type, true is converted to 1.0f and false is converted to 0.0f
for columns of double type, true is converted to 1.0 and false is converted to 0.0
for columns of decimal type, true is converted to BigDecimal.ONE and false is converted to BigDecimal.ZERO
for columns of string or text type, true is converted to "true" and false is converted to "false"
for columns of date/time or interval type, an IllegalConversionException is thrown.
member.param: one-based column number
the value for the column
member.returns: RESULT.ERROR_NONE on success or RESULT.BAD_REQUEST if called before initializeUpdate or after finishUpdate
member.exception: if the column parameter is less than 1 or greater than the number of columns in the collection mapping.
if update value cannot be converted to the column's data type.

for columns of integer type, no conversion is performed
for columns of long type, the value is promoted to a long
for columns of float type, the value is promoted to a float
for columns of double type, the value is promoted to a double
for columns of decimal type, the value is promoted to a decimal
for columns of string or text type, the value is converted to a String

member.summary:
Finds all member objects of the given class name. Sub-class objects and proxies may be excluded from the returned set. The following restrictions apply to the path parameter:
A path beginning with a double-colon (::) indicates an abosolute path.
A path beginning with a period (.) indicates a path relative to this object.
All others are treated as tag aliases and is not a very useful setting.

name of (base) class
include instances of subclasses
include proxy references

member.summary: Returns the current value of the member. If isSubscribed() returns true, the locally cached value is returned. Otherwise, the getServerValue() method is used to obtain the current value.
member.returns: object representing the value, timestamp, quality, et al
member.exception: if there is a problem communicating with the XHQ Solution Server.

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolMemberPrimitive.getServerValue
member.summary:
Returns the current value of the member. Perform a syncrhonous call with the XHQ Solution Server to get the value.
Note: if the member is not actively subscribed in the XHQ Solution Server, no useful value will be returned. Use getAggregateValue() or the subscription mechanism to avoid this ambiguity.
member.returns: object representing the value, timestamp, quality, et al
member.exception: if there is a problem communicating with the XHQ Solution Server.

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolMemberPrimitive.getServerValue(System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary:
Returns the current value of the member. Perform a syncrhonous call with the XHQ Solution Server to get the value.
Note: if the member is not actively subscribed in the XHQ Solution Server, no useful value will be returned. The waitTime and keepSubcribedTime parameters allow you to control this. You may also want to use getAggregateValue() or the subscription mechanism to avoid this ambiguity.
member.param: number of milliseconds to wait for value with quality other than "BAD, Not Initialized", use GSVOPT.WAIT* for special values.
number of milliseconds to keep the member subscribed, use GSVOPT.SUBCRIPTION* for special values.
member.returns: object representing the value, timestamp, quality, et al
member.exception: if there is a problem communicating with the XHQ Solution Server.
if non-positive or unknown wait/subscribe times are supplied.

member.summary: Gets the current value of the member specified by the given path from the XHQ Solution Server. A path can be relative, absolute, or aliases. A relative path must begin with a "." delimiter. Absolute paths begin with "::" marker. A path not beginning with one of these two markers is considered an alias.
member.param: the path corresponding to primitive member
member.exception: if there is a problem communicating with the XHQ Solution Server.
if the path parameter is null or of zero length.

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolObject.getServerValue(System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary:
Gets the current value of the member specified by the given path from the XHQ Solution Server. A path can be relative, absolute, or aliases. A relative path must begin with a "." delimiter. Absolute paths begin with "::" marker. A path not beginning with one of these two markers is considered an alias.
This version allows you to specify an optional wait and
member.param: the path corresponding to primitive member
number of milliseconds to wait for value with quality other than "BAD, Not Initialized", use GSVOPTS.WAIT* for special values.
number of milliseconds to keep the member subscribed, use GSVOPTS.SUBCRIPTION* for special values.
member.exception: if there is a problem communicating with the XHQ Solution Server.
if the path parameter is null or of zero length. Using non-positive or unknown wait/subscribe times will also cause this exception to be thrown.

member.summary: Gets the current values of the members specified by the given paths from the XHQ Solution Server. Paths can be relative, absolute, or aliases. A relative path must begin with a "." delimiter. Absolute paths begin with "::" marker. A path not beginning with one of these two markers is considered an alias. Check the quality of returned VTQ items to determine if the members are not found or access is denied.

member.summary: Gets the current values of the members specified by the given paths from the XHQ Solution Server. Paths can be relative, absolute, or aliases. A relative path must begin with a "." delimiter. Absolute paths begin with "::" marker. A path not beginning with one of these two markers is considered an alias. Check the quality of returned VTQ items to determine if the members are not found or access is denied.
member.param: an array of paths corresponding to primitive members
number of milliseconds to wait for value with quality other than "BAD, Not Initialized", use GSVOPTS.WAIT* for special values.
number of milliseconds to keep the member subscribed, use GSVOPTS.SUBCRIPTION* for special values.
member.exception: if there is a problem communicating with the XHQ Solution Server.
if the a name supplied in the paths parameter is null or of zero length. Using non-positive or unknown wait/subscribe times will also cause this exception to be thrown.

member.summary:
Gets the time series data from the members specified by the given paths and time ranges from the XHQ Solution Server as specified in the provided BulkTimeSeriesRequest object.
Checks for the validity of the paths specified in the bulk request.
Checks for the validity of the interpolation modes specified in the bulk request.
Checks to ensure that the numbers of points specified in the bulk request are non-negative.
Checks for the validity of the unit conversion policies specified in the bulk request.
Since: XHQ 4.5 SP1
member.param: a bulk request for time series data
member.exception: if there is a problem communicating with the XHQ Solution Server.
if any of the checks described above fail.

Retrieves the read and write access permissions for an array of XHQ points (specified by paths or aliases/tags), for the specified user. member.name: T:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolQueryCriterion
member.summary:
The SolQueryCriterion class represents a criterion for querying a collection in the XHQ solution namespace. The following rules are used when combining criteria for a query:
Criteria are considered to be ordered and processed based on the order supplied to the query.
Ordering criteria (ASC, DESC) are placed at the end of the query in the order found in the criteria list.
The DIST qualifying criterion is placed in beginning of the query. Note: this is deprecated.
All comparison criteria for different members are combined together with AND in the order submitted.
If two adjacent comparison criteria are encountered for the same member, these are combined in a subclause with OR. Note that intervening, non-comparison criteria are not considered when determining adjacency of comparison criteria.
Consider a collection that has members with the names Product, DefectCode with member IDs of 2 and 3 respectively. The following code creates a list of criteria.
final short P=2; // Product Member ID final short D=3; // DefectCode Member ID SolQueryCriterion[] c = new SolQueryCriterion[] { new SolQueryCriterion(P, SolQueryCriterion.EQ, new VariantValue(12)), new SolQueryCriterion(D, SolQueryCriterion.LT, new VariantValue(5)), new SolQueryCriterion(D, SolQueryCriterion.DESC, null), new SolQueryCriterion(D, SolQueryCriterion.GE, new VariantValue(15)), };
When processed by the XHQ Solution Server, the produces the following query constraints (in addition to the collection's constraints):
WHERE Product = 12 AND (DefectCode < 5 OR DefectCode >= 15) ORDER BY DefectCode DESC

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolQueryCriterion.EQ
member.summary: Value of member is equal to the specified constant value. If the member value is a string a LIKE comparison is used.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolQueryCriterion.NE
member.summary: Value of member is not equal to the specified constant value.

member.summary: Value of member is greater than to the specified constant value.

member.name: T:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolQueryMember
member.summary:
The SolQueryMember class represents queriable member of a collection or an aggregate function on a collection member. Instances of this class can be supplied in the columnOrder parameter of the ICollectionQuery.query method. A set of these may be obtained through the same interface using the makeQueryMemberArray method. Rollup (aggregate function) query members are of the form FUNC(MemberName) where FUNC is one of the supported functions defined by the ROLLLUP class.
Since: XHQ 4.0

member.name: T:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolTagSet
member.summary:
The SolTagSet class represents the data and tag objects returned from a tag collection query. A collection set operates in a manner similar to java.sql.RowSet interface. After the set is created by a query call (to a SolCollection instance or similar), call the next() method to move to the next row of data. Please be aware that when the local cache of rows is exhausted, the next() call may trigger a communication with the XHQ Solution Server to fetch more rows. The maximum number of rows fetched during one of these communications can be controlled by using the setMaxFetchRows.
A collection set only allows forward retrieval of rows. You may restart from the beginning using the requery() method.

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.SolTagSet.getTag
member.summary: Return the tag object represented by the current row in the tag set.
member.exception: if the set is in an invalid state such as when there was an error in the original query.
if there is a problem communicating with the XHQ Solution Server.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.Solution.SYSVAR_ROLESET_REVISION
member.summary: The role set revision ID. The role set revision changes whenever a change is made in the model catalog to user roles and permissions. Note that the changes for the current connection regarding permissions are not changed. To pick up any possible permission changes, the connection must be dropped and a new connection made.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.Solution.SYSVAR_CLIENT_NOTIFICATION

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.Solution.SYSVAR_CHILD_UPDATES
member.summary:
Children of an object have been added or removed. The value indicated the ID of the object that has changes to its set of children. This update may be sent after an "update-to-latest" or when objects are added or deleted in the extended namespace. A value of 0 means that top-level objets have beend added or deleted. Changes via tag sync or global collections are not included.
Since: XHQ 4.0

member.summary: The TimeSeriesResponse class represents the data returned from a time-series data request. It operates in a manner similar to java.sql.RowSet interface. After the response is returned by a getTimeSeriesData() call (to a SolMemberPrimitive instance), call the next() method to move to the next value.

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.TimeSeriesResponse.getBooleanValue
member.summary:
Return the boolean value corresponding to the current item. The following conversion rules are used with the various data types:
1. An integer or long value of 0 is converted to false and any other number is converted to true
2. A float or double value of 0.0 is converted to false, a BigDecimal value of BigDecimal.ZERO is converted to false and any other number is converted to true
3. A string or text value of "true" is converted to true and any other string or text is converted to false
4. Any date/time or time interval value of is converted to false
member.returns: the boolean value of the item
member.exception: if called before next() called or next() returns false

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.TimeSeriesResponse.getIntValue
member.summary:
Return the int value corresponding to the current item. The following conversion rules are used with the various data types:
1. A boolean value of false is converted to zero and true is converted to one
2. All floating-point values are truncated
3. All numeric values are constrained to the limits of the int type
4. A String value is parsed to int value, or converted to zero if the parsing fails
5. Date/time and time interval values are converted to zero.
member.returns: the int value of the item
member.exception: if called before next() called or next() returns false

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.TimeSeriesResponse.getLongValue
member.summary:
Return the long value corresponding to the current item. The following conversion rules are used with the various data types:
1. A boolean value of false is converted to zero and true is converted to one
2. All floating-point values are truncated
3. All numeric values are constrained to the limits of the long type
4. A String value is parsed to long value, or converted to zero if the parsing fails
5. Date/time and time interval values are converted to zero.
member.returns: the long value of the item
member.exception: if called before next() called or next() returns false

1. A boolean value of false is converted to zero and true is converted to one

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.TimeSeriesResponse.getTrendStatus
member.summary:
Gets the trend status of the current response as a com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.TimeSeriesResponse.Status enumerated type.
The Status type indicates the unit-conversion status of the response. See the documentation of the Status type for further details.
The value returned by this method has no relation to the value returned by the similarly named getStatus() method.

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.TimeSeriesResponse.getStatus
member.summary: Return the status of the time-series request.

member.name: T:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.TimeSeriesResponse.Status
member.summary: An enumerated type used to indicate the status of a com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.TimeSeriesResponse object regarding the conversion of its values from is source units to a target units.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.TimeSeriesResponse.Status.NO_CONVERSION_REQUESTED
member.summary:
Indicates that the time-series data request did not specify target units. The units of the data source were defined and are returned in the response.
1. Conversion calculations changed values: No
2. Target units applied: No (none to apply)
3. Error Condition: No

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.TimeSeriesResponse.Status.NO_CONVERSION_NEEDED
member.summary:
Indicates that no units were defined for the data source, and the time-series data request did not specify target units.
1. Conversion calculations changed values: No
2. Target units applied: No (none to apply)
3. Error Condition: No

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.TimeSeriesResponse.Status.UNITS_APPLIED_TO_UNITLESS
member.summary:
Indicates that no units were defined for the data source, but even so target units were provided in the time-series data request, and the request specified that the target units were to be applied to the response in the case of a unitless source.
1. Conversion calculations changed values: No
2. Target units applied: Yes (by request)
3. Error Condition: No

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.TimeSeriesResponse.Status.CONVERSION_SUCCESSFUL
member.summary:
Indicates that the values from the data source were successfully converted from the units defined for the data source to the target units specified in the time-series data request.
1. Conversion calculations changed values: Yes
2. Target units applied: Yes
3. Error Condition: No

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.TimeSeriesResponse.Status.UNITS_OVERRIDDEN_BY_REQUEST
member.summary:
Indicates that target units were provided in the time-series data request, but the data source has incompatible units, but the request also specifies that the target units were to be applied to the response anyway.
1. Conversion calculations changed values: No
2. Target units applied: Yes (by force)
3. Error Condition: Yes

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.TimeSeriesResponse.Status.NO_SOURCE_UNITS
member.summary:
Indicates that no units were defined for the data source, and, while target units were provided in the time-series data request, the request did not specify that the target units were to be applied to the response in the case of a unitless source.
1. Conversion calculations changed values: No
2. Target units applied: No
3. Error Condition: Yes

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.TimeSeriesResponse.Status.INCOMPATIBLE_UNITS
member.summary:
Indicates that the units specified in the time-series data request are not compatible with those defined for the data source, and the target units were not applied for that reason.
1. Conversion calculations changed values: No
2. Target units applied: No
3. Error Condition: Yes

member.name: T:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.UCONVPOLICY
member.summary:
Code for selecting a policy for the handling of bad unit conversion.
Since: XHQ 4.5 SP1

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.UCONVPOLICY.INVALID
member.summary: Unit conversion policy: Invalid code...used as a return value for the valueOf() method.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.UCONVPOLICY.NORMAL
member.summary:
Unit conversion policy: Treat any attempted conversions not strictly allowed by the unit categories as an error.
Change the numeric values as specified by the appropriate conversion formula for the units involved.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.UCONVPOLICY.APPLY_UNITS_TO_UNITLESS
member.summary:
Unit conversion policy: Treat attempted conversions from no-units to units as OK.
No change to numeric values.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.UCONVPOLICY.IGNORE_INCOMPATIBLE_UNITS
member.summary:
Unit conversion policy: Treat attempted conversions between incommensurable units as OK.
No change to numeric values.

member.name: P:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.UCONVPOLICY.FORCE_ALL_CONVERSIONS
member.summary:
Unit conversion policy: Treat attempted conversions from no-units to units as OK, and treat attempted conversions between incommensurable units as OK
No change to numeric values.

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.UCONVPOLICY.valueOf(System.String)
member.summary: Translate a conversion policy name to a code.
member.param: The conversion policy name as returned by the toString method.
member.returns: The conversion policy code, or INVALID if the name is null, or matches no valid code.

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.UCONVPOLICY.toString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Translate a conversion policy code to a name.
member.param: The conversion policy code as defined by this class
member.returns: The standard conversion policy name for the code, or null if the code is not one of the four valid codes (NONE, APPLY_UNITS_TO_UNITLESS, IGNORE_INCOMPATIBLE_UNITS or FORCE_ALL_CONVERSIONS).

member.name: T:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.UserExpressionManager
member.summary:
The UserExpressionManager class allows you to create, update and delete ephemeral, user-defined expression members in the Solution namespace.
A user-defined expression member is a unmodeled member of the solution namespace that is configured with an expression relative to a modeled instance in the solution. The lifespan of these members is determined by the user that creates and deletes these via this API. The configuration of these is not persisted across restarts of the XHQ Solution Server and no user-defined expression members are created except by way of the API.
Since: XHQ 4.5 SP1

member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:com.indx.xhq.solution.clientapi.UserExpressionManager.CreateRequest.add(System.Byte,System.String,System.String,com.indx.xhq.util.TimeInterval,com.indx.xhq.util.Timestamp)
member.summary: Add a configuration to the request. This version takes a path as a reference instance for the expression context.
member.param: the data type of the expression - use SolMemberPrimitive.TYPE_*

the absolute path to the referenced instance in the solution for the expression execution context. This can be null but any member reference in the expression must be by absolute path or alias only (no relative paths).
the expression to compile and execute for the newly created member.

the time interval defining the schedule period of execution. If the expression is time-based (e.g., uses Now() or time-based aggregates), or if a periodic execution of the expressoin is desired, this paramater must be 60000ms (1 minute) or more. Otherwise it must be set to null, meaning the expression is evaluated based on change to referenced members.
the base time for the scheduled execution. This must be null if the schedulePeriod parameter is 0.
